page.title: 05LOCAL HISTORY
page.content: The oldest building is Morland Church tower which is the only SAXON tower in Cumbria.It's immense walls and rounded arches date it.It is thought to be a tower marking the influence of a Saxon noble and to it was added a Norman nave in the C12.The first priest,Adam' signed a document in 1179. About 100 years later the first rebuilding took place which resulted in the present nave and transepts. Further changes took place after the Reformation in the C15 and C16 when the chancel was built and the tower height raised so that bells could be put in. During the C19 the church fell into decay and at the end of that century the last great restoration took place when the present day church emerged.
